abstract.para: Administrating clusters with the various tools like the crm shell, &hawk;, or the &hbgui; can only be used by &rootuser; or any user who are part of the hacluster group. In some cases this may be not enough as you want to assign more fine-grained access.

Access control lists (ACLs) let you define rules to allow or deny access to any part of the cluster configuration. Typically, rules are combined to create specific roles and users may be assigned a role to make access more consistent and easier.

sect1.title: Requirements and Prerequisites
sect1.para: Before you start using ACLs on your cluster, make sure the following conditions are fullfilled:

listitem.para: The same users must be available on all nodes in your cluster. Use NIS to ensure this.
All users must belong to the hacluster group.
User &rootuser; and users belonging to the hacluster group has always full access.
Non-privileged users want to run the crm shell, they have to change the PATH variable and extend it with /usr/sbin.
In order to use ACLs you need minimum knowledge about XPath. XPath is a language for selecting nodes in a XML document. Refer to or look into the specification at .

sect1.title: Knowing the Basics of ACLs
sect1.para: An ACL role is a set of rules which describe access rights to CIB. Rules consists of these parts:

listitem.para: Access rights to read, write, or deny,
An XPath expression where to apply this rule.

sect1.para: Using ACLs is usually specifying a role and assigning a role to a user. However, it is also possible to give a user certain access rules without defining any roles.

sect1.para: With the XPath language you can locate nodes in this XML document. For example, to select the root node (cib) use the XPath expression /cib. To locate the global cluster configurations, use the XPath /cib/configuration/crm_config.

sect1.title: Configuring ACLs with the &hbgui;
sect1.para: Use the &hbgui; to define your roles and users. The following procedure adds a monitor role which has only read access to the CIB. Proceed as follows:

step.para: Start the &hbgui; and log in as described in .
Click the ACLs entry in the Configuration tree.
Click Add. A dialog box appears to choose between ACL User and ACL Role.
Define your ACL role(s):
Choose ACL Role. A window opens to add your configuration options.
Add a unique identifier in the ID textfield, for example monitor.
Click Add and choose the rights (Read, Write, or Deny). In our example, select Read and proceed with Ok.
Insert the XPath expression /cib into the Xpath textfield. Proceed with Ok.
If you have other conditions, repeat the steps ( and ). In our example, this is not the case so your role is finished and you can close the window with Ok.
Assign your role to a user:
Click the Add button. A dialog box appears to choose between ACL User and ACL Role.
Choose ACL User. A window opens to add your configuration options.
Enter the username in the ID textfield.
Click Add and choose Role Ref.
Use the role name specified in .
